properties.name: Boston, MA
properties.description: Posted by CaroltronBoston, MABoston is a modern, fashionable city. It is also known as "Bean Town." Some believe its character is veru much like London. Which is true considering it is a melting pot of history. It also has a cosmopolitan character. Harvard University is just across the river in Cambridge. Boston also carries the capitol building with its famous gold dome, which was painted grey during WWII.

properties.name: Christ Redeemer Statue
properties.description: Posted by CaroltronRio de Janeiro, BrazilThe Christ Redeemer Statue is on top of Corcovado Mountain. Construction started in 1926 and completed in 1931. Brazilian, Heitor da Silva Costa, designed the statue and was also the engineer in charge of the construction. French sculptor, Paul Landowski was also involved in the construction of the statue. There is a small chapel housed in the base that can hold up to 150 people. The statue is one of the most visited and best known monuments in the world. It represents Jesus standing with outstretched, welcoming arms. The statue stands at 38 meters tall and faces the east. The span from fingertip to fingertip of the statue is 28m. It was constructed of soapstone.

properties.name: Ellis Island
properties.description: Posted by CaroltronEllis Island, New YorkEllis Island, originally called "Liitle Oyster Island," its located at the mouth of the Hudson River in New York. It was the main entrance to the United States for immigrants at one time. 12 million immigrants were inspected by US Bureau of Immigration before entering the United States from January 1, 1892, when the island opened to immigrants, to November 12, 1954. Now Ellis Island has a museum that people get to by a ferry. Outside the main building there is a "Wall of Honor," in which people can make a donation to honor any immigrant that entered the United States.

properties.name: Freiburg, Germany
properties.description: Posted by Caroltronfreiburg, GermanyFreiburg was founded by the Dukes of Zähringen in 1120, and the layout of streets and squares of the prospering metropolis is still reflected in today’s cityscape. In Freiburg, you encounter historic sights at each corner. The Cathedral Square is surrounded by impressive buildings, the tallest being the steep-roofed historical Kaufhaus or Old Merchants’ House with its colorfully adorned bartizans. Sights worth seeing are the Old and New Town Halls, the House of the Whale, with its late Gothic portal, the Basle Court and the two medieval city gates (Martinstor and Schwabentor), which still stand to this day. THe historic Old Town has numerous different historical museums, monuments, theaters, and restaurants including bars. Making the city popular among students and other visitors. THe Gothic Cathedral has an unique 381-foot-high tower rank among the masterworks of Gothic architecture. It took over 300 years to build the masterpiece. The Cathedral takes pride in place as Freiburg\'s main landmark.

properties.name: Hagia Sophia
properties.description: Posted by CaroltronIstanbul, TurkeyThe original Hagia Sophia was built by the first christian emperor, Constantine the Great, in the fourth century. Unfortunately the original does not remain. Hagia Sophia use to be a Byzantine church and former Ottoman mosque in Istanbul but now is a museum. It is also know as "Church of Holy Wisdom." The Hagia Sophia has a classical basilica plan. It is covered by a dome slightly smaller than the one in the Pantheon in Rome. All interior surfaces are made of polychrome marble, green and white with purple porphyry, and gold mosaics. The architecture of the building is really amazing and the detail of the inside is breath taking. It was used by Christian and Muslims as a place of worship. The most famous mosaics in the Hagia Sophia are located in the upper level of the gallery. In the South Gallery is the best-known mosiac of the Hagia Sophia, called the Deësis Mosaic. The Hagia Sophia is known to be one of the world\'s greatest buildings.

properties.name: Neuschwanstein Castle
properties.description: Posted by CaroltronSchwangau, GermanyNeuschwanstein Castle is located on a mountain top in Germany. Ludwig II of Bavaria built the palace as a retreat and as a homage to the King\'s inspiring muse, Richard Wagner. The castle is Germanys most photograped castle. And is one of the countrys most visited place by tourists. Ludwig did not allow visitors in the castle but when it opened in 1886, over 50 million people visited the castle. Now about 1.5 million people annually visit it. Neuschwanstein Castle was designed by a theatrical set designer, named Christian Jank. Note, he was not an architect but a set designer. Now Neuschwanstein Castle is owned by the state of Bavaria.

properties.name: Paris, France
properties.description: Posted by CaroltronparisParis, known as the "City of Lights" is one of the most beautiful cities in the world. The city\'s roots reach to the 3rd century B.C., and influences as diverse as Celtic, Roman, Scandinavian, and English are woven into the city\'s rich heritage. Paris is today one of the world\'s leading business and cultural centres, and its influence in politics, education, entertainment, media, fashion, science and the arts all contribute to its status as one of the world\'s major global cities. Paris is one of the most popular tourist destinations in the world, with over 30 million foreign visitors per year. There are numerous landmarks among its many attractions, such as the Eiffel Tower, the Paris Opera House,the Louvre, and Arc de Triomphe.

properties.name: Rome, Italy
properties.description: Posted by CaroltronRome, ItalyThe traditional date for the founding of Rome, based on a mythological account, is April 21, 753 BC. Italy had been the land of Roman Empire for long. Today the country has a rich history and tradition that speaks for itself and gathers tourists from all round the world. Italy is a place known for its wonderful cities and their archaic art and architecture. There are great Roman structures to see like Roman Colosseum and Pantheon. In the picture above, it shows holes in the side of the Colusseum, that is because the marble that made up the exterior of the Colusseum was removed to make weapons and other useful things in times of need.

properties.name: Santiago, Chile
properties.description: Posted by CaroltronsantiagoSantiago is located in Chile\'s central zone and the Andean Mountain Range can be seen from almost anywhere in the city. The Santa Lucia Hill, in the center of the city, is where the Spanish Conquistador Pedro de Valdivia founded the city of Santiago on February 12th, 1541. He planned the city to be built according to the traditional Spanish checkerboard layout, which is still the layout of the city today. Downtown Santiago has historical landmarks such as Santa Lucia Hill - National Library-Casa Colorada (Museum of Santiago), Santo Domingo Temple, and the San Francisco Church- Paris-Londres Neighbourhood-Catholic Univerty\'s Main Campus-Vera Cruz Church. And it also has many museums including the Colonial San Francisco of Contemporary Art, of popular American Art, of Natural History, and many others.

properties.name: Washington Monument
properties.description: Posted by CaroltronWashington D.c.As a memorial to George Washington, the Washington Monument was built between 1848 and 1884. The monument weighs 90,854 tons and stands 555\' 5-1/8" tall. Its interior structure is supported by an ironwork frame nad it walls are made from white marble from Maryland and Massachusetts. Theres a flight of 897 steps that go up to the observation area. The monument has more than 800,000 visitors each year.
